column5: and lake simcoe isn't happening without a boat what do you do you find another lake to fish and that's just what we did 2.5 hour drive from simcoe but lots of ice the lake holds walleye whitefish and lake trout and it did not disappoint us Lloyd was already on the ice when I got there and had only got a bass so far, but as we caught up on what was happening he hooked into a laker then a nice walleye my turn some whitefish were caught and more walleye, so it was a good day waiting for simcoe to freeze over I played with my new gopro 3 but was not happy with the underwater low light results. the marcum handled the low light much better...maybe it was the setting on the hero...a work in progress time to get the boat out as always a good time fishing
Nice!
great vids and some nice fish to start the season.
Thank you.
Good day for you guys , thanks for sharing
Great stuff.  I'd take a day like that over the zoo of simcoe any day of the week.
Saw this on the "other" board, and I repeat...awesome stuff Terry!
Fantastic! Nice mixed bag o' fish
Great stuff Terry.  We may have to head up a bit more north too.  This waiting for Simcoe is for the birds  Some really nice fish there and love the videos.
Like always good to hook up with you Terry. Will think of you on Thursday as I'm sitting in the same spot while your hard at work lol
Those are some nice fish buddy. To bad I had to miss that trip. Lots ice to be had still.
Looks like a great day on the water.
Awesome videos Terry    and some nice fish
thanks all can't wait to do it all again
Wow  Nice going guys... Nice to see some fish caught.
Nicely done. Can't wait to get after some Trout be they Lakers, Specks or otherwise. Thanks for sharing.
Same Lloyd that used to fish the ganny 15-20 years ago??
yup! I still fish the Ganny just not 24/7 anymore
Small world!
No you're not Wayne, Lloyd... Wayne was working...you was RnR'n!!  I see the forum update has messed the links and embedding!
Way to go Terry!!!,some real nice fish there.

How the hell did i miss this post!  Awesome job boys.  How deep were you using your gopro?....how did you rig it for underwater?  Is the marcum better in low light because it has infrared lights on the camera?   Fantastic fish too guys....that walleye was a piggy!
no I never use the lights I am hoping I can tweak the gopro settings and get better resaults, but time will tell
Surprised I missed this one too. Nice to see some fish on the ice for you guys.  Cheers, Ron...
Very Nice Fellas We are going to be Perching on Simcoe for a while yet!!! Rick
